keyTakeAways: Governor Josh Shapiro is set to publish a memoir titled 'Where We Keep the Light: Stories From a Life of Service' on January 27, 2025.
The book details Shapiro’s political rise, personal trauma from a fire that destroyed his home, and his commitment to public service.
The fire occurred in April, when an arsonist set fire to the governor’s mansion while Shapiro and his family were sleeping.
Cody Balmer pleaded guilty to arson and attempted murder and was sentenced to 25 to 50 years in prison.
Shapiro was on Kamala Harris’ shortlist as a potential vice presidential running mate in the 2024 election.
Shapiro is seen as a rising figure in national Democratic politics and a potential 2028 presidential candidate.
The book emphasizes themes of family, faith, and community service, reflecting on his journey from political rise to personal adversity.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro is set to release a memoir titled 'Where We Keep the Light: Stories From a Life of Service' on January 27, 2025, through HarperCollins. The book chronicles his political rise, personal trauma from a fire that destroyed his home in April, and his commitment to public service. The fire, which occurred while Shapiro and his family were asleep and just after a Passover gathering, led to charges against Cody Balmer, who pleaded guilty to arson and attempted murder and was sentenced to 25 to 50 years in prison. Shapiro was also considered for Kamala Harris’ vice presidential shortlist in 2024, and is now seen as a rising national Democratic figure with potential for the 2028 presidential race.
title: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro to Release Memoir on January 27, 2025, Covering Political Rise and Trauma from Home Fire
